~This module provides a convenient way to convert <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|int>> or <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|string>> types
to abstract types~.


~Motivation~: type <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|int>> may be used for representing several kinds of
data~. ~Confusion is easy~, so we often need to make it abstract~,
while keeping~:
* the functions that used to work with type <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|int>>
* efficiency
* no creation of specific modules

~This solution was suggested by ~Jacques ~Garrigue~.
~What the user has to do is <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|open ~Opaque>> and then
use a type parameter to define
the specialized version of <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|int>> or <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|string>>~.
~We will write the type declarations as
<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|type port ~= ~[`~Port~] int~_t>> or <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|type date ~= ~[`~Date~] int~_t>>~.
~Data is converted with the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|int~_t>> and <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|t~_int>> polymorphic
functions as in <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|let port ~: port ~= int~_t ~0>>~.
